column4: pingfloyd: OK, think I have got it: please check is this is correct: the main one (sda2) is the windows user space, I back up my files from this, delete this partition? Then will I have unallocated space in gparted to creat a new partition within?
pingfloyd: why?
pingfloyd: why sda4, what is lvm?
pinkfloyd: what is lvm? (OK)
logical volume management - a way to assign diskspace at will later
in the last line the "main restricted universe multiverse" (or whatever you like) is missing
- I cant get back in to change it?
gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list   should get you an editing session

you are a whiz - that worked. Now, what I was trying to do originally was install: scribus-1.3.6.tar.bz2 that I have extracted and got lots of files but dont know what to do with them - can you help further?
why are you trying to install that from source? it is in the repos
sorry I dont follow.
this is a newer version than I have installed.
in ubuntu you usually install software with the proper management tools
do you mean Package Manager?
as this version is not listed in it.
I mean synaptic or software center or apt-get or aptitude
software centre does not list this version, neither does package manager: what would be the command in a terminal if I have downloaded and extracted to a folder on the desktop?
why do you need this version?
someone in scribus channel recommeded I update because the bug I wanted to report is probably covered by the 150 bugs fixed in this release.
I see - please type "/msg ubottu compile" here in the channel (without the quotes) - that should give you something to read :-)
you have referred me to:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CompilingSoftware  is that what you mean?
yes - if you are going to compile software yourself you will have to know what you are doing :)
OK, thank you for your help :-)
I know it was no real help :-)
